intro: Echinospermum strigosum, commonly known as the hairy echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Echinospermum strigosum is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
